description: JupyterMCP - Jupyter Notebook Model Context Protocol Integration. Connects Claude AI to Jupyter Notebook through a WebSocket-based server for two-way communication, cell manipulation, and notebook management. Compatible ONLY with Jupyter Notebook version 6.x.

tools.name: ping
tools.description: Check server connectivity and verify the connection to the Jupyter WebSocket server.

tools.name: insert_and_execute_cell
tools.description: Insert a cell at the specified position and execute it. Supports both code and markdown cells with optional slideshow type configuration.

tools.name: save_notebook
tools.description: Save the current Jupyter notebook to disk.

tools.name: get_cells_info
tools.description: Get information about all cells in the notebook including cell IDs, positions, content, and types.

tools.name: get_notebook_info
tools.description: Get information about the current notebook including metadata and overall state.

tools.name: run_cell
tools.description: Run a specific cell by its index and return the execution output.

tools.name: run_all_cells
tools.description: Restart and run all cells in the notebook. Requires user approval.

tools.name: get_cell_text_output
tools.description: Get the text output content of a specific code cell by its index with configurable output length limits.

tools.name: get_image_output
tools.description: Get image outputs from a specific cell by its index, supporting PNG, JPEG, and SVG formats.

tools.name: edit_cell_content
tools.description: Edit the content of an existing cell by its index and optionally execute it after editing.

tools.name: set_slideshow_type
tools.description: Set the slideshow type for a specific cell (slide, subslide, fragment, skip, notes) for presentation purposes.
